title: C9 and TSM in the Finals again...How Boring...
body:
This just shows you how much NA still sucks internationally, imho.  C9 or TSM or both will go to Worlds again, but it doesn't really matter.  They never perform well (especially C9).  Sure TSM won the last IEM, but that was because of several 'flukes' and they didn't really prove anything.  It would be so nice to see fresh blood at Worlds, but NA just doesn't have what it takes yet.

Based on this here is a poll.

replies.body: C9 and TSM (even if just the brands) are so stale and they never do well at Worlds.  We need fresh meat in the NA LCS BIGTIME.  Lets hope for newer teams to do better.

> [{quoted}](name=Zraebiel,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-04-18T20:03:41.497+0000)
>
> C9 and TSM (even if just the brands) are so stale and they never do well at Worlds.  We need fresh meat in the NA LCS BIGTIME.  Lets hope for newer teams to do better.

Agreed.  Its surprising how EU and LPL/Korean teams constantly out-do each other, but NA is still stuck with C9 and TSM on top.  I agree with the op as well... it doesn't show NA is doing that well comparatively.

IEM was not a "fluke". Just lucky things happened. Tigers lost. C9 was demolished. SK lost because they banned out Forgiven. Gambit was themselves. You can not take away how well TSM did at IEM. Even if they didn't win, they still played well every game. Most of it came with pick/ban.

You saying that TSM and C9 are in the finals because the rest of the teams suck internationally? What does that even mean? CLG choked sadly, TIP played well game one. C9 almost didn't make it. But because they knew what TL was going to run with jugger'maw, they could easily counter it. And after that game 3 lost, Piglet just went on tilt. Because TL honestly has Piglet on their team, he doesn't allow other players to shine. Unlike players like WildTurtle who just plays stupidly. But because he speaks english, he fits. Piglet not speaking english clear enough, hurts TL in communication. Piglet and WildTurtle are the same person. They both are solo q ADCs. More so Piglet. But still.

I followed and agreed with the comment up until you said that Game 3 was piglets fault. He's the only consistently performing member on the team. 

Game 3 TL ran a single threat (Easily shut down and a rather poor comp) Jugger'Maw is always a two threat comp. Putting Fenix on a support instead of a carry like the first two games wrecked the momentum. 

Honestly that started a team wide tilt, that unfortunately spanned the remaining games.

Comparing Wildturtle to Piglet is another thing I just cannot agree with.  Wildturtle just makes terrible decisions, Piglet is an emotion driven player. He wants to be perfect so he is constantly analyzing his play and it can cause him to be distracted or even spacey. You see it sometimes when he streams.

They both outperformed all the EU teams last season at worlds, with TSM handing the eventual winners one of their few losses. 

TSM just won IEM.

> [{quoted}](name=Pigby,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-04-13T05:03:23.033+0000)
>
> They both outperformed all the EU teams last season at worlds, with TSM handing the eventual winners one of their few losses. 
> 
> TSM just won IEM.

The EU teams are much better this season so we'll see what happens there.  TSM won IEM because of a few factors.  They were set up to win and had an easy time in groups and didn't have to face GE Tigers who's loss was a fluke or really well devised strategy so international competition wouldn't learn many of their strats.  

Thorin breaks it down really well here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUhz7DAcqSs

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Yunii,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-13T06:20:49.191+0000)
>
> Thorin breaks it down really well here: 

Thorin has also said, on multiple occasions on his casts, that he hates TSM. So him saying IEM was nothing but a fluke doesn't surprise me at all.

> [{quoted}](name=NeoDeimos,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2015-04-13T21:57:27.573+0000)
>
> Thorin has also said, on multiple occasions on his casts, that he hates TSM. So him saying IEM was nothing but a fluke doesn't surprise me at all.

He didn't like what Reginold did to Monty, but saying he said he hates TSM is a pure lie. lol

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Yunii,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-13T06:20:49.191+0000)
>
> The EU teams are much better this season so we'll see what happens there.  TSM won IEM because of a few factors.  They were set up to win and had an easy time in groups and didn't have to face GE Tigers who's loss was a fluke or really well devised strategy so international competition wouldn't learn many of their strats.  
> 
> Thorin breaks it down really well here: 
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUhz7DAcqSs

EU teams are much better? They both got fucking rekt at IEM, and SK the supposed best team in EU, didn't even get past the semi-finals of EU playoffs.

And GE Tigers didn't win off a "fluke." You can maybe lose a best of 1 off a fluke but to drop 2 games in a row in a best of 3? That's not a "fluke" that's just not performing when it counts. GE as a team has been falling off anyways, after IEM they've dropped series to both KT and SKT.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Yunii,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-04-13T00:48:34.516+0000)
>
> This just shows you how much NA still sucks internationally, imho.  C9 or TSM or both will go to Worlds again, but it doesn't really matter.  They never perform well (especially C9).  Sure TSM won the last IEM, but that was because of several "flukes" and they didn't really prove anything.  It would be so nice to see fresh blood at Worlds, but NA just doesn't have what it takes yet.

And what do you have to say about Fnatic being in all 5 EU LCS finals? Must mean that EU sucks as well, quite boring having the same team in the finals all the time, hmm?

If NA "sucks" internationally, then what do you have to say about other regions?

Since the beginning on Season 4, NA has shown itself to clearly be above SEA (if you want to talk about "flukes", right there it is.. SEA was somehow thought of as an actual region during Seasons 3 & 4 when the teams that went to Worlds from SEA were no better than the Wild Cards), and NA is above EU as well. Prior to the influx of Koreans into the Chinese scene, NA wasn't that far behind most of China either (i.e. In the group stage, TSM split with eventual runner-up SHRC).
Its still Fnatic vs someone else.  I think you're missing the point of this thread.

Regardless, they goto finals. Because they bested all of whom that came their way in the NA spring split. Who destroyed who's nexus? I personally was pleasantly entertained with the semi-final games between TL/C9 and TSM/TIP. More so the TSM game, because bjerg is a strong mid laner and isn't scared to pick bursty champions. Which in turn make the game very interesting at almost all points. Besides, You shouldn't be so negative, show support for NA and who knows.. they could beat the best of other countries for the win. S5 could be NA's chance to win worlds.

> [{quoted}](name=Charmed by Ahri,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-13T00:57:03.543+0000)
>
> Regardless, they goto finals. Because they bested all of whom that came their way in the NA spring split. Who destroyed who's nexus? I personally was pleasantly entertained with the semi-final games between TL/C9 and TSM/TIP. More so the TSM game, because bjerg is a strong mid laner and isn't scared to pick bursty champions. Which in turn make the game very interesting at almost all points. Besides, You shouldn't be so negative, show support for NA and who knows.. they could beat the best of other countries for the win. S5 could be NA's chance to win worlds.

I don't disagree with that.  What I'm saying is that its been... 4 or 5 years now and they have proved themselves very little.  Yes, they are still NA's  strongest teams overall, but in comparison internationally they don't match up well.

Considering TSM was one of only 2 teams (along with second place SHRC) that managed to beat Samsung White in a game at world championships, something which not even fellow Korean team Samsung Blue managed to do, I'd argue that TSM actually manages to compare very well internationally.

> [{quoted}](name=Gixia,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-13T06:04:48.083+0000)
>
> Considering TSM was one of only 2 teams (along with second place SHRC) that managed to beat Samsung White in a game at world championships, something which not even fellow Korean team Samsung Blue managed to do, I'd argue that TSM actually manages to compare very well internationally.

They got to the quarterfinals.  That doesn't mean much.  And, if you'll remember they had to span the game to heck late to win and ply won once.  White's 1 Achilles heel was that they didn't usually have to play the late game so didn't have as much practice there.  They still played well and even better now with a new jungler, but my point remains.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Yunii,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-13T06:13:27.767+0000)
>
> They got to the quarterfinals.  That doesn't mean much. 

TSM split 1-1 against SHRC, a team that made it to the finals. Who are you to say that TSM couldn't have also beaten the same teams that SHRC did?

The fact remains that everyone knew SSW was going to win last year, so it doesn't matter when you lost to them, whether it was in the quarters, or the finals itself, TSM proved that they were every bit as good as one of the last 2 remaining teams.

I am pretty sure TSM is a constantly evolving team. They have not had the same roaster for a year yet. You have to be crazy to think that the TSM of a 2 years ago is the same one of today. 

C9 is the oldest team right now when it comes to the same members. How dare they not switch it up and randomly find new talent for you. Man those pricks.

Also 3 teams go to worlds so who knows who else is going to go. C9 and TSM are the current power houses in NA but only cause they work at it. C9 is the all NA team they made the LCS together and have done the work to adapt. TSM takes the american philosophy and runs with it, they do not care where your from they want what they think is the best players and work to make a team from that. 

I am not sure why your board with these teams. They have to work for their spots, its not like people are giving a free pass in the LCS.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaosu Desu,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=F4sceUXU,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-13T05:16:23.398+0000)
>
> I am pretty sure TSM is a constantly evolving team. They have not had the same roaster for a year yet. You have to be crazy to think that the TSM of a 2 years ago is the same one of today. 
> 
> C9 is the oldest team right now when it comes to the same members. How dare they not switch it up and randomly find new talent for you. Man those pricks.
> 
> Also 3 teams go to worlds so who knows who else is going to go. C9 and TSM are the current power houses in NA but only cause they work at it. C9 is the all NA team they made the LCS together and have done the work to adapt. TSM takes the american philosophy and runs with it, they do not care where your from they want what they think is the best players and work to make a team from that. 
> 
> I am not sure why your board with these teams. They have to work for their spots, its not like people are giving **a free pass in the LCS.**

Lustboy
i meant santorium.

yeah I am bored with C9vsTSM rivalry.
for some games, sure it lighted the fire. But if it keep repeating itself, it's the same as baiting the boredom

why the other regions have rise and fall
meanwhile NA "oh.. it's TSM vs C9 again"

Well currently NA is looking better internationally than EU. TSM won IEM, even if it is because they didn't have to face GE, that's GE's fault for not stepping up against WE. It was a best of 3, so it's not like it was pure luck that WE won. Last year at worlds NA made it further when NA and EU looked about equivalent in skill. Even at allstars in 2014, NA did better in groups.

EU really needs to step up internationally right now. I'm personally glad UOL knocked SK out. I think both unicorns and fnatic could show up stronger internationally than SK. I'm really pumped for the MSI now.

Anyways, related to the post, I definitely want to see C9 at worlds, and TSM too if they keep playing how they are now. I hate that it's still the same two teams on top, but I want to see NA get to semis at worlds, and these are the best two teams to give NA that chance. Right now based on team strength I think TIP and TL are good candidates for third. However, as a fan, I'd like to see CLG finally pull through and get to another worlds.
other teams need to get good. hating on x team for being good makes no sense.

Lmao
Everytime beens swapping players non stop, changing names, even coaches and they still can't beat the top 2 teams. Instead of acknowledging that, you come to rant about how boring it is. Wow! Like how about you say, gee guys c9 has the same players for two years in a row and has been getting top 2 in lcs since, with no changes compared to everyone else. How about saying guys TSM only got a new jungles and wrecked everyone

Like seriously, just reading your post you can smell the rooting hate or dislike you have for these teams
Looks like somebodys team got knocked out
TSM! TSM! TSM!
